unit_learning_outcomes.description: Judge how control of infectious diseases has impacted on public health law and policy
Critically review and evaluate surveillance systems for infectious diseases
Describe the principles of infectious disease epidemiology
Apply the principles of outbreak investigation in the context of containing infectious diseases

assessments.description: Case study interpreting real world surveillance data

Reflection on experience in the unit with consideration of expectations on entry and outcomes at completion of the unit. This reflection may contribute to course based assessment in the Capstone Unit.
A series of activities (MCQ, short answer, problem solving, engagement) designed to foster engagement with weekly learning materials

assessments.assessment_title: Cases studies in infectious disease monitoring and control
assessments.description: A combination of tasks focused on appraisal and analysis of control of specific infectious diseases

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: In this unit, students gain an understanding of how infectious diseases, from tuberculosis to COVID-19, have significantly impacted on human populations. You will focus on infectious disease epidemiology to learn about how diseases spread both locally and globally. You will explore the concepts of source of infection and immunity, surveillance as a tool for understanding burden of disease and impact of control strategies, and outbreak investigations to identify sources and management of disease spread. You will explore these themes through case studies such as sexually transmissible diseases, HIV/AIDS and vaccine preventable diseases. You will explore current out-break investigations and infectious disease surveillance methods; and will learn how key aspects of, and innovations in, infectious disease management have impacted on public health law, management and policy.
data.title: Infectious Disease Epidemiology

You will explore these themes through case studies such as sexually transmissible diseases, HIV/AIDS and vaccine preventable diseases. title: Infectious Disease Epidemiology
